Articles.Content:
On 11/30/2019 at 1:48 AM, MaximumThrust said:

I also think this is a great ideia. The current version of SVT should work with KSP 1.8.1 when Kopernicus gets updated?

Just tried it in 1.8.1. Works like a champ for me.

20 minutes ago, Raven. said:

Just tried it in 1.8.1. Works like a champ for me.

Sure, but its not using the new shader, so you are only making the game look worse with this mod now, as far as terrain goes

 

 

Edited February 5, 2020 by Galileo

14 minutes ago, Galileo said:

Sure, but its not using the new shader, so you are only making the game look worse with this mod now, as far as terrain goes

 

 

Considering that I just moved from KSP 1.3.1 to 1.8.1, I'm assuming that I'm missing some big change that happened?

1 minute ago, Raven. said:

Considering that I just moved from KSP 1.3.1 to 1.8.1, I'm assuming that I'm missing some big change that happened?

yes.. 1.8 introduced a new terrain shader

Anybody experience this too?

This only happens at Dawn/Dawn Twilight and only on Vall, but I only went to a few Bodies since I installed SVT. Also sometimes the Terrain at Kerbin randomly starts vibrating like an Earthquake but I didn't manage to record it yet.


OK, not really like an Earthquake as I can tell by Experience but I hope you get the Idea

 

EDIT: It seem like YouTube processed most of the Glitch out of the Video; the Terrain looks a bit "wobbly"; like this unwanted Effects you might get when Filming something with tightly packed Stripes (I'm horrific at describing Things).

Edited February 9, 2020 by derbleifuss

Is this mod known to work with 1.9? Or did it pull a Scatterer and break completely?

@alberro+this requires kopernicus, which hasn't yet been updated to 1.9

As Galileo stated above you, this mod isn't required anymore cause of the new terrain shaders implemented since 1.8.

2 hours ago, rettter3 said:

@alberro+this requires kopernicus, which hasn't yet been updated to 1.9

As Galileo stated above you, this mod isn't required anymore cause of the new terrain shaders implemented since 1.8.

Thanks.
I will likely update it eventually as I have a lot of nice textures for the new shader. We’ll see. What squad has provided so far has done a really nice job at replacing this mod.

Currently still running in 1.7.x, all my Mun enhancement textures are no longer working.

All other bodies in the system are fine, I've checked, but the Mun has lost its re-texture and dust clouds. I assume this is because of a clash between mods, but I am unsure what two.

Does anyone else have a similar problem, and if so, how did you fix it?

I have no idea where to even start to fix this so if anyone is willing to help, I can provide any data or game files needed.

Many thanks in advance.

On 2/16/2020 at 3:33 PM, Galileo said:

I will likely update it eventually as I have a lot of nice textures for the new shader. We’ll see. What squad has provided so far has done a really nice job at replacing this mod.

I hope you do, at the rate squad are going KSP 2 will be out before they update the whole kerbol system.
I wonder if this works for 1.10.1.....

1 hour ago, kylelander said:

I wonder if this works for 1.10.1.....

Not recommended.  The new stock terrain shader that began being phased in with KSP v1.8 far surpasses what this mod was able to do.  This mod is a big improvement when applied to pre-1.8 versions of KSP, but for 1.10.1 you'll have better looking terrain if you just stick with plain stock.  That's not to say this mod won't eventually be updated, but for now it's mostly obsolete.

FYI, I think there's something coming in the future that will be way better than anything we've seen yet.  It appears the creator of Parallax is working on a stock planet terrain upgrade.  The preview screenshots look fantastic.

 

Edited November 1, 2020 by OhioBob

13 hours ago, OhioBob said:

Not recommended.  The new stock terrain shader that began being phased in with KSP v1.8 far surpasses what this mod was able to do.  This mod is a big improvement when applied to pre-1.8 versions of KSP, but for 1.10.1 you'll have better looking terrain if you just stick with plain stock.  That's not to say this mod won't eventually be updated, but for now it's mostly obsolete.

FYI, I think there's something coming in the future that will be way better than anything we've seen yet.  It appears the creator of Parallax is working on a stock planet terrain upgrade.  The preview screenshots look fantastic.

 

Yeah, I look forward to Parallax's stock configs' release as well!
I've seen old vids from Matt Lowne and his Jool is like super green and vibrant. Is this the mod that re-textures Jool?
I have yet to see the mun look like the screenshot that galileo has been pointing to, am I missing something?  Does it disable itself if you are missing some kind of graphics card feature?

On 11/29/2020 at 10:18 PM, QuakeIV said:

I have yet to see the mun look like the screenshot that galileo has been pointing to, am I missing something?  Does it disable itself if you are missing some kind of graphics card feature?

You have to turn up the terrain quality in the graphics settings, then restart the game.
I've been using the scatter collision config provided here because I like that immersion, but it's not working anymore since I upgraded to 1.9.1. Has anyone else been experiencing this?

is there  a way i can get just jool's rings? i tried messing with the jool config and ring dss and removing the other files but it just gives me semi-transparent white rings

Edited March 29, 2021 by Drupegod02
